ai.summary: A challenging 22.7 km hike along the Bruce Trail Friendship Trail in the UK, offering varied terrain and a long distance that tests endurance.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied terrain with rocky and dirt paths, forested sections, and occasional exposed areas. Expect moderate elevation changes and uneven footing in places.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long hike (typically 6–9 hours). Stay on marked trails and check weather conditions before you go. Carry ample water (2–3 liters) and high-energy snacks. Wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers; bring a waterproof jacket. Have a map and compass or GPS, plus a headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries. Carry a small first aid kit and an emergency whistle. Inform someone of your plan and expected return; be aware that mobile reception may be limited in remote sections. Start early to ensure daylight.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Lightweight rain cover or packable rain shell
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (approximately April–October).
